Welcome!

Header Layout

This page uses the Header layout. You can add and image, video, or solid color in the header section above. This area can contain text or not. You can add most any of the elements, including a map or slideshow!

April 2019

In The Spotlight | ​What You Need to Know | Wellness | High Five ​
Physicians enjoy breakfast and lunch to celebrate Doctor's Day. See photos.
Spring into Wellness
In this issue, find wellness and informatics resources, and save the date for the June 27 Medical Staff Meeting and Awards Ceremony.​ READ MORE >

CHAT WITH A CHAIR

Edward Schaeffer, MD, PhD, Chair of Urology
For Edward Schaeffer, MD, PhD, the desire to solve complex problems - and bike to every Northwestern Medicine hospital – turns his wheels. READ MORE >
 

IN THE SPOTLIGHT

Save the Date! June 27 Medical Staff Awards
Two residents and a physician will be recognized during the June 27 Medical Staff meeting for academic excellence, empathy and humanism. READ MORE >
From Hospital to Health: Transitional Care Clinic
The clinic provides a full range of post-acute care services to patients recently discharged from the hospital or its emergency department. It aims to provide support for those who lack adequate insurance and resources. READ MORE >
Five Questions With Dinee Simpson
She's NMH's first female African-Amercian transplant surgeon. Her single biggest accomplishment is also her biggest challenge. Meet Dr. Simpson. READ MORE >
NM and Eko Partner to Improve Heart Disease Screening
Bluhm Cardiovascular Institute is pioneering the use of artificial intelligence (AI) for cardiac screening in a new clinical trial using Eko’s cardiac monitoring platform. READ MORE >
​Back to Top
HEALTH INFORMATICS UPDATE
From Nancy Sassower, MD:
This new newsletter section will provide regular updates on the work of the Health Informatics team to promote the understanding of, effective use of and satisfaction with technology for patient care.​ READ MORE >
​Back to Top
 

WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW

Epic Privacy Reminders
As required by Northwestern Medicine’s Privacy Policy, health care providers may not access medical records without a business purpose. READ MORE >
Important Policy Changes Regarding Informed Consent
During its recent visit to Northwestern Memorial Hospital, The Joint Commission identified two issues related to informed consent for procedures. It’s important for you to take note and corrective action, as needed. READ MORE >
Epic Changes to Comply With The Joint Commission
Adjustments to Epic were implemented on Monday, April 15, to comply with The Joint Commission recommendations. READ MORE >
Back to Top
 

WELLNESS

Wellness Seminar to Feature Stanford Chief Wellness Officer
On May 22, nationally-recognized physician wellness expert Tait Shanafelt, MD, Stanford Medicine will host two sessions, 7 to 8 am and noon to 1 pm, which will be will be live-streamed to all regions. RSVP now to attend a live presentation. READ MORE >
Scholars of Wellness Program Update
Gaurava Agarwal, MD, shares what the group has learned about drivers of burnout and potential solutions. READ MORE >
Attend Osher Center Spring Self-Care Series
Learn about self-care, including how to practice mindfulness and ways to get a better night’s sleep. Register for a single session or for the entire series. READ MORE >
​5 Yoga Stretches You Can Do at Work
If you’re looking for more ways to introduce calm throughout the day, view these five easy yoga stretches you can do at your desk or any time you need to hit refresh on your busy day. READ MORE >
​Back to Top
 

HIGH FIVE

Surgeon Receives Highest Honor From American Academy of Orthopaedic Surgeons
Samer Attar, MD, received the 2019 Humanitarian Award for his extensive medical efforts on behalf of underserved populations across the globe READ MORE >
​Back to Top

IN BRIEF

Everbridge for Crisis Messages Went Live at NMH April 9
​Everbridge messages are key to real-time emergency communications. Please add your cell phone number to Purple Pages or provide it to MyHR. READ MORE >
Continuity of Care Across Communities
Unique longitudinal clerkships enable Feinberg students to provide primary care to vulnerable populations. Published in Northwestern Medicine Magazine). READ MORE >

NM Scholars Program Aims to Close Diversity Gap
NBCNews.com explores how programs like Northwestern Medicine Scholars at Westinghouse College prep are working to improve diversity in medicine. READ MORE >

​Hispanic Brain and Spine Tumor Program Addresses Patient Needs
The program at Robert H. Lurie Comprehensive Cancer Center of Northwestern University at Northwestern Memorial Hospital, was launched to better serve patients who prefer to communicate in Spanish. It is led by Adam Sonabend, MD, neurosurgeon; Jean-Paul Wolinsky, MD, neurosurgeon; and Roger Stupp, MD, neuro-oncologist. READ MORE >
​Back to Top

​Back to Top
DO YOU KNOW?
Feinberg School of Medicine
Student Population
  • Medical students: 680
  • Residents: 1,189
  • Post-Doctoral fellows: 418
Faculty: Around 4,000
  • Regular faculty: 45%
  • Contributed Service: 19%
  • Research: 7%
  • Other: 29%
​Research
  • 4,571 clinical trials 2017-2018
  • 30,851 patients and volunteers
  • Feinberg generates 69% of research dollars at Northwestern University​
